sen.j: 仏哲（ぶってつ、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代の渡来僧。
sen.e: Buttetsu (仏哲, date of birth and death unkown) was a Buddhist monk who came from abroad during the Nara period.
Buttetsu (year of birth and death are unkown) was a priest from a foreign country in the Nara period.
Buttetsu (year of birth and death are unkown) was a priest from a foreign country in the Nara period.
Buttetsu name was also written this way, "仏徹."
Buttetsu (仏哲) was also written as '仏徹.'
Buttetsu (仏哲) was also written as '仏徹.'

sen.j: チャンパ王国フエの出身。
sen.e: Buttetsu was from Fue, in the kingdom Champa.
He was from Fue, Kingdom of Champa.
He was from Fue, Kingdom of Champa.

sen.j: インドに入り菩提僊那に師事して密呪に秀でた。
sen.e: Buttetsu entered India and studied under Bodai Senna, he excelled in the Mitsuju (secret dharani).
He entered India and studied under Bodai Senna, he excelled in the secret dharani (occult art).
He entered India and studied under Bodai Senna, he excelled in the secret dharani (occult art).

sen.j: 唐開元年間（713年 - 741年）菩提僊那とともに唐に入り。
sen.e: During the Tang Kaiyuan era (713-741), Bodai Senna and Buttetsu traveled to Tang, followed by Rikyo, a Buddhist monk visiting Tang from Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Kaiyuan era (713-741) of the Tang Dynasty, he entered Tang with Bodai Senna.
During the Kaiyuan era (713-741) of the Tang Dynasty, he entered Tang with Bodai Senna.

sen.j: 当時日本から唐に入っていた僧理鏡らの招きにより、726年（天平8年）師の菩提僊那・唐の僧道センとともに来日した。
sen.e: Rikyo invited Buttetsu to Japan, and then in'726', Buttetsu accompanied by his master Bodai Senna and Dosen a Budist monk of Tang dynasty, visited Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: By the invitation of Japanese including a priest Rikyo, in 726 he came to Japan with his master Bodai Senna and a priest from Tang Dosen (Daoxuan).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: By the invitation of Japanese including a priest Rikyo, in 726 he came to Japan with his master Bodai Senna and a priest from Tang Dosen (Daoxuan).

sen.j: 大宰府を経て京に入り、奈良大安寺に住した。
sen.e: Buttetsu entered Kyoto via the Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region), and lived in the Daian-ji Temple of Nara.
After visiting Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region), they entered the capital and stayed at Daian-ji Temple of Nara.
After visiting Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region), they entered the capital and stayed at Daian-ji Temple of Nara.

sen.j: 「菩薩」・「抜頭」などといった舞や林邑楽（雅楽の楽種の一つ）を伝えた。
sen.e: Buttetsu taught dance performances such as Bosatsu (Bodhisattva)" and "Bato music," and he also taught Indian song and dance [a kind of music of gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music)].
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Buttetsu taught some dance performances including 'Bosatsu' and 'Bato,' and 'Rinyugaku' (Indian music for dance later developed as a gagaku [Japanese court dance and music]).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Buttetsu taught some dance performances including 'Bosatsu' and 'Bato,' and 'Rinyugaku' (Indian music for dance later developed as a gagaku [Japanese court dance and music]).

sen.j: また多くの密教経典も請来したという。
sen.e: It was said that Buttetsu was responsible for the introduction and teaching of several Mikkyo kyoten (Descriptive bibliographys of Sanskrit Buddhist literature) in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has been said that Buttetsu brought a lot of scriptures of Esoteric Buddhism.
It has been said that Buttetsu brought a lot of scriptures of Esoteric Buddhism.

sen.j: 大安寺では林邑楽などを楽人に教え、752年（天平勝宝4年）の東大寺大仏開眼供養会の際も舞を伝授した。
sen.e: At the Daian-ji Temple, Buttetsu taught and performed in Indian song and dance for gakunin (player).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At Daian-ji Temple, he taught Rinyugaku to musicians and in 752 at the ceremony of Kaigan-kuyo (consecrating a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes) of Daibutsu (statue of Buddha) of Todai-ji Temple, he taught some dance to performers.
sen.cmt: 用語。文を分けていたのを元の一文に戻しました。
sen.e: At Daian-ji Temple, he taught Rinyugaku to musicians and in 752 at the ceremony of Kaigan-kuyo (consecrating a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes) of Daibutsu (statue of Buddha) of Todai-ji Temple, he taught some dance to performers.
